intro: Lippia grisebachiana, commonly known as the gray lippia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Lippia grisebachiana is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
